meanings.definition: The highest class in certain societies, especially those holding hereditary titles or offices.
meanings.sent1: In some countries, aristocracies have special titles like 'duke' or 'count'.
meanings.sent2: The aristocracies in ancient Rome had great power and influence.
meanings.sent3: The aristocracies decided to have a fancy dress party to show off their status.
meanings.sent4: The aristocracies of nature, like lions and eagles, rule their habitats.
meanings.sent5: The aristocracies of the animal kingdom are truly majestic.

meanings.definition: A government or state ruled by an aristocracy.
meanings.sent1: The aristocracies established laws that favored their own interests.
meanings.sent2: During that time, aristocracies controlled the entire nation.
meanings.sent3: The aristocracies' idea of a perfect society was one where they had all the power.
meanings.sent4: The aristocracies' rule was like a velvet glove hiding an iron fist.
meanings.sent5: Living under aristocracies meant following their strict rules.

meanings.definition: The nobility or those considered to be of high social status.
meanings.sent1: The aristocracies were invited to the royal ball due to their high social standing.
meanings.sent2: In history, aristocracies were often seen as the elite of society.
meanings.sent3: The aristocracies were so fancy that even their pets wore jewels.
meanings.sent4: Her elegance and grace made her the aristocracies' queen of the ball.
meanings.sent5: The aristocracies' wealth and influence were unmatched in the kingdom.
